Class Exercise

  • java.lang.Object
    • Exercise

  • public class Exercise
extends java.lang.Object
    This program has five different functions One function checks to see if a string contains a digit The other four functions are different methods to check to see if a string is a palindrome

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Exercise() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean hasDigit(java.lang.String str)
      This function checks to see if a string str contains a digit using a for loop, looping through and checking ascii number of each character
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method of the program calls each function in the program
      static boolean noCharIterative(java.lang.String s)
      Function checks to see if a string s is a palindrome using an iterative loop without using the charAt().
      static boolean noCharRecursive(java.lang.String s)
      Function checks to see if a string s is a palindrome using recursion without using the charAt().
      static boolean palindromeIterative(java.lang.String s)
      This function checks a string s to see if it is a palindrome using an iterative for loop, looping through to check to see if the first and last are the same, then 2nd and 2nd to last, etc.
      static boolean palindromeRecursive(java.lang.String s)
      This function checks a string s to see if it is a palindrome using recursion, checks to see if the first and last are the same, then 2nd and 2nd to last, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method of the program calls each function in the program

      • hasDigit

        public static boolean hasDigit(java.lang.String str)
        This function checks to see if a string str contains a digit using a for loop, looping through and checking ascii number of each character
        Parameters:
        str - the string previously inputted in the main function

      • palindromeRecursive

        public static boolean palindromeRecursive(java.lang.String s)
        This function checks a string s to see if it is a palindrome using recursion, checks to see if the first and last are the same, then 2nd and 2nd to last, etc. and continues until this is not true. if it is palindrome it will return true if it is not, will return false
        Parameters:
        s - the string being checked if it is a palindrome

      • palindromeIterative

        public static boolean palindromeIterative(java.lang.String s)
        This function checks a string s to see if it is a palindrome using an iterative for loop, looping through to check to see if the first and last are the same, then 2nd and 2nd to last, etc. and continues until this is not true. if it is a palindrome it will return true if it is not, will return false
        Parameters:
        s - the string being checked for a palindrome

      • noCharRecursive

        public static boolean noCharRecursive(java.lang.String s)
        Function checks to see if a string s is a palindrome using recursion without using the charAt(). It uses s.substring( , ) instead
        Parameters:
        s - the string being checked for a palindrome

      • noCharIterative

        public static boolean noCharIterative(java.lang.String s)
        Function checks to see if a string s is a palindrome using an iterative loop without using the charAt(). It uses s.substring( , ) instead
        Parameters:
        s - the string being checked for a palindrome
